title: Review & setlist: Like clockwork, Boston fell in love with Laufey at TD Garden
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Concert Reviews A Berklee College of Music alumna, Laufey dazzled and delighted in her Boston homecoming with a five-act performance filled with whimsy, nostalgia, and undeniable talent.
Laufey performs at TD Garden in Boston on Monday, Oct.

title: Patriots sign CB Marcus Jones to contract extension
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots Jones was originally a third-round pick in 2022.
Marcus Jones at Patriots practice in October.
Matthew J Lee/Globe staff By Hayden Bird October 28, 2025 | 1:52 PM 1 minute to read One of the Patriots‘ early-season playmakers is set to stay at Foxborough for a little while longer.

title: Only one Papa Gino’s remains in Boston after Hyde Park location closes
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News The Hyde Park location closed over the weekend.
Another Papa Gino's has closed, leaving only one location left in Boston proper.
(AP Photo/Bill Sikes) A Papa Gino’s pizzeria shuttered in Hyde Park over the weekend, leaving only one location of the Massachusetts chain left in Boston proper.

title: Visiting Salem on Halloween? Here’s what the city wants you to know.
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel The city is tripling fines for illegal behavior.
A costumed reveler dressed as Frankenstein's monster walks among people in Salem.

Photo by JOSEPH PREZIOSO/AFP via Getty Images As the historic city of Salem gears up for another iconic Halloween celebration, officials say visitors should take public transportation, and that fines will be tripled for illegal behavior.

title: State website directly blames Trump for SNAP suspension; lawmaker halts session in protest
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Like the Trump administration, the state government is now using official government websites for partisan messaging about SNAP benefits.
Massachusetts Gov.
Maura Healey.

title: Flight diverted to Boston after passenger allegedly stabs 2 teens with fork
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Praneeth Kumar Usiripalli, 28, of India, is charged with one count of assault with a dangerous weapon.
Lufthansa aircrafts are parked at the airport in Frankfurt, Germany, Thursday, March 7, 2024.
AP A Lufthansa flight traveling from Chicago to Germany on Saturday was diverted to land in Boston after a man allegedly stabbed two teens with a metal fork.

title: Former Fall River mayor says he was ‘inches from death’ after violent attack
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News “I know this: I will never take another day for granted.
I will love deeper.
I will forgive quicker.

title: iRobot still can’t find a buyer
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The Bedford-based Roomba maker says its search for a buyer has hit a wall amid ongoing financial troubles.
The iRobot headquarters in Bedford, Mass.

Bloomberg photo by Sophie Park iRobot’s efforts to find a buyer have hit a wall, deepening uncertainty about the company’s future months after it warned investors of “substantial doubt” about its ability to stay afloat.
